data.enText: to walk somewhere in a slow relaxed way
People were strolling along the beach.
We went for a stroll in the park.

ex.chText: 漫步乡间，你会发现很多乐趣。
ex.enText: You will find a lot of fun when you ramble in the country.

synonyms.bx: 尤指为消遣而在乡间闲逛。

ex.chText: 在他的别墅里，狗可以四处走动。
ex.enText: Dogs are allowed to roam freely in his villa.

ex.chText: 小孩子晚上不应该在街上游荡。
ex.enText: Children shall not roam the streets at night.
A couple of lovers roam the countryside.

synonyms.bx: 常指长时间没有目的或方向地游荡。

ex.chText: 警方已经抓住了在乡村流窜的那些盗贼。
ex.enText: The police have caught the thieves who roved the countryside.

ex.chText: 作为一名全国各地跑的推销员，他很少有时间陪伴家人。
ex.enText: As a salesman roving the country, he has little time to spend with his family.

synonyms.bx: 指到各处游历、走动等，无明确的目的地。

ex.chText: 她和朋友们有说有笑地溜达着。
ex.enText: She and her friends were strolling along, talking and laughing.

ex.chText: 他喜欢晚饭后在海滩散步。
ex.enText: He likes to stroll along the beach after supper.

tr: a leisurely walk (usually in some public place)
walk leisurely and with no apparent aim

value.def: If you stroll somewhere, you walk there in a slow, relaxed way.

example.ex: He collected some orange juice from the refrigerator and, glass in hand, strolled to the kitchen window...
example.tran: 他从冰箱里拿了点橘子汁，然后手拿杯子溜达到厨房的窗口。

example.ex: Afterwards, we strolled back, put the kettle on and settled down with the newspapers.
example.tran: 然后，我们溜达回来，烧上水，又坐下看报纸。

example.ex: After dinner, I took a stroll round the city.
The foggy streets were virtually empty, except for the occasional evening stroller.
example.tran: 除了偶尔一两个傍晚出来散步的人，雾蒙蒙的街上空荡荡的。
